titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to University of Texas at Arlington Catalogs, etc. Cubb.00268
titlestmt.author: Kathy Kerns

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-08-22 10:32:26 -0700.

did.unittitle: University of Texas at Arlington (formerly: Arlington State College; formerly: North Texas Agricultural College; formerly: Grubbs Vocational College)
did.abstract: Located in Arlington, Texas. Established in 1895 as Arlington College. Changed name several times: Carlisle Military Academy (1902), Arlington Training School (1913), Arlington Military Academy (1916). In 1917 it was taken over by the state and became Grubbs Vocational College, a branch of the Agricultural & Mechanical College of Texas (later Texas A&M). In 1923 it became North Texas Agricultural College, and in 1949 Arlington State College. In 1965 it separated from Texas A&M and became part of The University of Texas System, changing its name to The University of Texas at Arlington in 1967.

physdesc.extent: Catalogs for 1950-1954 Announcements for 1956/58, 1963/64, 1965/66-1966/67 General Information Bulletins for 1965/66-1966/67
General Information Bulletins for 1967/68-1969/70 Catalogs for 1967/68-1969/70 Undergraduate catalogs for 1972/73-1977/78 Graduate catalogs for 1969/70, 1972/73-1973/74, 1976/77-1977/78
